page.title: 11FARMING
page.content: The area surveyed is mainly devoted to agriculture. The farms are usually between 2-300 acres and are concerned with stock rearing both sheep and cattle. This means that the land cover is intensively managed grassland with some rough pasture on poorly drained land especially in the north along the flood plain of the River Irthing. Some crops such as rape and turnip are grown and grass is cut for hay. Although there are some dairy herds, the majority of cattle are Fresian-Hereford cross bred for meat. All stock is sold at 2 years old. The cattle are kept outside for most of the year while the grass continues to grow but are brought inside for winter. The cows calve during January and February whilst the cows are inside and then all the cattle are taken outside when the weather permits
